results.firPara: Five Wales internationals recall mixed memories of games against the neighbours – from being outclassed at Old Trafford to winning in Wrexham
results.secPara: I was born in England but qualified for Wales through my grandfather. Its a great honour to play international football but theres an added incentive when youre playing against the country where you grew up and, in my case, the nation that all my family and friends supported.
results.webTitle: Passion, pride and payback – five former Wales players on clashes with England

results.firPara: Marek Hamsik scored a spectacular goal and inspired Slovakias first win at a European Championship despite a traumatic last 10 minutes
results.secPara: Marek Hamsik scored a spectacular goal and inspired Slovakias first win at a European Championship despite a traumatic last 10 minutes
results.webTitle: Russia 1-2 Slovakia: Euro 2016 – as it happened

results.firPara: Middlesbrough have confirmed they have reached an agreement to sign Colombian defender Bernardo Espinosa when his contract with Spanish club Sporting Gijón expires at the end of June.
results.secPara: The 26-year-old centre-half will become Aitor Karankas second signing of the summer when he completes his move to Teeside on 1 July, with the Denmark international Viktor Fischer having agreed a move from Ajax last month.
results.webTitle: Middlesbrough confirm deal to sign Colombian defender Bernardo Espinosa

results.firPara: Iceland has a population of 330,000. Cristiano Ronaldo has 112,312,087 followers on Facebook. But only one of them was left looking small in Saint-Étienne
results.secPara: Nearly 10% of Icelands population are in France this summer, but the remaining few are enjoying their Euro 2016 glory from home – none more so than the staff of the Reykjavik Grapevine, the English-language magazine who were live-tweeting their first match on Tuesday night. As Cristiano Ronaldo fannied about during Icelands crushing defeat of Portugal, the writers in Reykjavik gathered more and more friends online. Here is their somewhat partisan account of the contest
results.webTitle: 'Iceland inflict crushing 1-1 defeat on Portugal' – the view from Reykjavik

results.firPara: Kari Arnason, the Iceland defender, has responded to Cristiano Ronaldos scathing attack on his teams European Championship debut by branding the Portugal captain a graceless human being who will always be regarded as inferior to Lionel Messi.
results.secPara: The smallest country at the tournament made a memorable first appearance on the international stage on Tuesday when holding Portugal, three-time semi-finalists and the 2004 runners up, to a 1-1 draw in Saint-Étienne. That prompted a remarkably petulant outburst from the former world player of the year Ronaldo, who accused a team representing a country of 330,000 inhabitants of possessing a small mentality and had the temerity to mock their post-match celebrations. They are not going to do anything in the competition, he said following a record-equalling 127th appearance for Portugal.
results.webTitle: Iceland’s Kari Arnason: sore loser Ronaldo will always be behind Messi

results.webTitle: Ecuador ready for USA test – and they have the quality to hurt the hosts

results.firPara: German second-tier club St Pauli improvised when their manager Ewald Lienen was unable to attend the unveiling of their new signing – using a man in an Ewald Lienen mask instead.
results.secPara: Club officials, who were announcing the deal for 22-year-old Borussia Dortmund striker Marvin Ducksch, came up with the solution when Lienen missed the press conference, but the ruse was quickly spotted online.
results.webTitle: St Pauli manager misses unveiling of new signing, so club use man in mask

results.firPara: On the face of it, they make an unusual couple. Two individuals divided by several generations and very different backgrounds. Roy Hodgson and Wayne Rooney with not a huge amount in common, one imagines, once professional interests are removed. And yet, their stories are so entwined it is tempting to wonder how far we have to go back before locating another England manager and captain with the same form of attachment.
results.secPara: A long time, presumably, judging by the letter Rooney keeps at home along with his England caps, the shirts and other memorabilia. It arrived one day last October, shortly after Englands final qualifying game, and it was Hodgsons way of putting on record his gratitude for Rooneys contribution. There was a bottle of champagne, too, but it was the eulogy in Hodgsons spidery handwriting that showed Rooney, more than anything, how highly his manager valued him.
results.webTitle: England’s odd couple: how Wayne Rooney and Roy Hodgson work together

results.firPara: Wed recommend Ronaldo take a long hard look at himself in the mirror if we didnt know that he already spends several hours a day doing exactly that
results.secPara: Wed recommend Ronaldo take a long hard look at himself in the mirror if we didnt know that he already spends several hours a day doing exactly that
